I'm a UX designer with front-end chps

But first a father and a husband. Priorities, right?

My strengths are understanding and analyzing user data and turning that into useful outputs via interfaces, user flows or defining the experience for a site. I'm also a competent web developer (HTML, CSS, Sass and some jQuery).

Originally I studied industrial engineering in Lima, Per√∫, but a couple of years after graduating and learning web development and design on my own, I made the switch (the big career change!). I joined an education non-profit with a web development wing called Laboratoria. Now, I'm studying a 10 week course in General Assembly in Seattle to consolidate my skills and have a solid foundation on which to grow on this new career path.

Other stuff I enjoy

  • Reading an awesome book (fiction or non-fiction)
  • Running (semi-barefoot)
  • Learning some thing new (it is additcive)
  • Traveling (nature or cities)
  • Hanging out with my family
  • Eating and drinking awesome coffee
